author: Staff Reporter
text:
The City Police have arrested five people in connection with various thefts and chain -snatching incidents in and around the city.

A senior official of the city police said a team from J.J. Nagar police station was carrying out a routine vehicle check on Saturday night, when five people, who were driving their two-wheelers rashly, were stopped for enquiry. When the gang was not giving clear answers, police conducted a check and detained them for possessing knives. On further investigation, it was discovered that the five including N. Karunakaran (24), R. Ponmani (23), R. Janakiraman (24), Arumugam (23) and Sasikumar (34), were involved in several chain-snatching and motorcycle-lifting incidents.

Of the five arrested, Karunakaran is believed to be the kingpin of the gang. He has two attempt-to-murder cases, assault and several chain-snatching cases against him. He had been detained under Goondas Act along with Arumugam and Janakiraman.

The police seized knives, five stolen two-wheelers and two mobile phones.
title: Five held for theft, chain-snatching
